alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:26PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD, HOCKING, SOUTHEASTERN PICKAWAY AND NORTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EDT... At 1026 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Circleville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Nelsonville, Kingston, Hocking Hills State Park, Starr, Stoutsville, Laurelville, Murray City, Adelphi, Tarlton, Buena Vista in Hocking County, Gibisonville, Ilesboro, Haydenville, Lake Logan State Park, Whisler, South Bloomingville, Clearport, Enterprise and Union Furnace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
